info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 12 at 1:24PM MDT until September 12 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS Grand Junction CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Slot canyon flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Utah, including the following county, San Juan.
* WHEN...Until 430 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Slot canyons and steep, dry washes can become raging currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Do not attempt hiking or canyoneering.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 124 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.4 and 0.7 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fry Canyon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Immediately climb to higher ground. Runoff concentrated through narrow canyon walls can quickly become dangerous, life threatening conditions.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON
